content.raw:
If they are all still current, please confirm. It seems like yes, there is a way to submit with this process, but at some point there was some discussion about submission of team solutions via docker-compose.yml files? Is that an option or not? 

We are mirroring your process of passing arguments in the docker-compose.yml to the entrypoint .bash file that launches our controller. So we have one image, that can be launched with different arguments. If we aren’t able to use docker-compose in our submission, we have to build a separate image for each robot, where the only change is these arguments.  For this circuit,  that’s fine, but if we are scaling up the number of agents later in the competition, it’s going to be very inefficient.

Also, an up-to-date checklist of requirements for successful submission would also be useful - e.g. do we still need to call /subt/start? /subt/finish? Check recent issues for similar information that could be included so the answers are all compiled in one place: \(current cloudsim version or how often it’s updated, requirements for solution docker, name restrictions, NVIDIA driver version compatibility, etc\).

Thanks.

‌
content.html:
If they are all still current, please confirm. It seems like yes, there is a way to submit with this process, but at some point there was some discussion about submission of team solutions via docker-compose.yml files? Is that an option or not?

We are mirroring your process of passing arguments in the docker-compose.yml to the entrypoint .bash file that launches our controller. So we have one image, that can be launched with different arguments. If we aren’t able to use docker-compose in our submission, we have to build a separate image for each robot, where the only change is these arguments. For this circuit, that’s fine, but if we are scaling up the number of agents later in the competition, it’s going to be very inefficient.

Also, an up-to-date checklist of requirements for successful submission would also be useful - e.g. do we still need to call /subt/start? /subt/finish? Check recent issues for similar information that could be included so the answers are all compiled in one place: (current cloudsim version or how often it’s updated, requirements for solution docker, name restrictions, NVIDIA driver version compatibility, etc).

Thanks.

‌
